item.title: As EU waters down 2035 EV goals, electric startups express concern
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: The future may be electric, but that future is being postponed. The European Commission, citing the need for flexibility, has softened its ambitious plan to ban the sale of gas-powered cars by 2035. Instead of requiring 100% of new cars to be zero-emission vehicles by that date, the revised plan would allow 10% of new […]

item.title: OpenAI allows users to directly adjust ChatGPT’s enthusiasm level
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: ChatGPT users can now tweak the chatbot’s warmth, enthusiasm, and emoji use.

item.title: Building venture-backable companies in heavily regulated spaces
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: This week on Build Mode, Startup Battlefield editor Isabelle Johannessen spoke to two founders who are working to make progress in industries ripe for disruption, despite the regulatory headaches that might have deterred many other people.

item.title: Where are investors placing their bets next year? AI, AI, AI.
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Investors at TechCrunch Disrupt explained their focus on artificial intelligence and offered advice to founders on how to stand out in a crowded AI field.

item.title: Cursor continues acquisition spree with Graphite deal
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Graphite is an AI code review assistant that was last valued at $290 million.

item.title: Yann LeCun confirms his new ‘world model’ startup, reportedly seeks $5B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Renowned AI scientist Yann LeCun confirmed on Thursday the worst-kept secret in the tech world: that he had indeed launched a new startup. Although he did say he will not be running the new company as its CEO.

item.title: Hardware’s brutal week: iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power go bankrupt
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Anthony Ha, Rebecca Bellan, Sean O'Kane
item.description: The hardware world had a brutal week, with iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power Bikes all filing for bankruptcy.  Each company faces its own mix of tariff pressures, supply chain issues, and shifting markets, but together they tell a larger story about the challenges of building physical products in an era of global trade tensions and […]

item.title: Netflix acquires gaming avatar maker Ready Player Me
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The gaming startup will allow Netflix subscribers to create avatars that can extend across gaming titles.

item.title: Krafton hikes India bet with new $670M fund
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Called the Unicorn Growth Fund, the investment vehicle is a collaboration between Krafton and South Korean internet conglomerate Naver and investor Mirae Asset. It aims to deploy around $669.3 million over four years.

item.title: From Roombas to e-bikes, why are hardware startups going bankrupt?
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: The hardware world had a brutal week, with iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power Bikes all filing for bankruptcy.  Each company faces its own mix of tariff pressures, supply chain issues, and shifting markets, but together they tell a larger story about the challenges of building physical products in an era of global trade tensions and cheap overseas competition. From […]

item.title: These startups are building innovations that make life (and death) better
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Founders Gabriel Sanchez (Enspectra Health) and Tom Harries (Earth Funeral) share what it takes to build in heavily regulated industries where “move fast and break things” simply won’t work. In this episode of Build Mode, they reveal the realities of navigating FDA approval processes, state-by-state regulations, and cultural taboos while building products that are literally […]

item.title: Trump Media is merging with fusion power company TAE Technologies in $6B+ deal
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant, Amanda Silberling
item.description: The merger would broaden Trump Media’s holdings into the nascent fusion power space while data centers clamor for more electricity amid the ongoing AI boom.

item.title: TDK Ventures, Accel set to back India’s EtherealX in reusable launch vehicle push: Sources
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: EtherealX aims to take on SpaceX's Falcon 9 with its fully reusable rocket.

item.title: No keynotes, no BS — why this year’s best tech talks happened over cocktails at StrictlyVC
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Impactful talks and connections happen at StrictlyVC. Read the full 2025 recap and join the 2026 waitlist to get access to the lowest ticket prices.

item.title: Making life (and death) better despite regulatory barriers
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Founders Gabriel Sanchez (Enspectra Health) and Tom Harries (Earth Funeral) share what it takes to build in heavily regulated industries where “move fast and break things” simply won’t work. In this episode of Build Mode, they reveal the realities of navigating FDA approval processes, state-by-state regulations, and cultural taboos while building products that are literally […]

item.title: Vibe-coding startup Lovable raises $330M at a $6.6B valuation
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Lovable has seen its valuation more than triple just five months after the company's last funding round in July.

item.title: Former Rivian exec says ‘Every car company will become a robotics company’
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Jiten Behl, partner at Eclipse and former chief growth officer at Rivian, thinks we’re entering an era of major re-industrialization in the U.S. — one where factories run on AI-powered robots, not cheap overseas labor. Behl, who helped scale Rivian from a conference room idea in 2015 to a publicly traded EV maker, is now […]

item.title: Radiant Nuclear raises $300M for its semi-sized 1 MW reactor
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Radiant Nuclear is developing a small modular reactor to replace diesel generators. The startup previously raised $165 million in May.

item.title: Coursera and Udemy enter a merger agreement valued at around $2.5B
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Coursera and Udemy, two of the biggest names in online learning, are combining platforms next year.

item.title: Weeks after raising $100M, investors pump another $180M into hot Indian startup MoEngage
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The deal valued MoEngage at "well over" $900 million post-money.
